titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. James Cundiff, Indictment
CWG7419

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Kentucky Adair County Sct
Circuit Court November Term 1865
The Commonwealth of Ky Plff
against } Indictment Assault & Battery
James Cundiff Deft

This day came as well the attorney for the Commonwealth as the Defendant in proper person in discharge of his bail bond and the Deft confesses Judgment for the sum of twenty five dollars & the attorney for the Commonwealth agrees to accept a Judgment for that amount, Therefore it is adjudged that the Defendant make his fine to the Commonwealth of Kentucky by the Judgment of Twenty five dollars & that he pay the costs of this prosecution & may be taken &c
A Copy Test James T. Page C, A, C, C
